intro: Talinum carinatum, commonly known as Brazilian spinach or garden spinach, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink or red flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its edible leaves and ornamental value. Talinum carinatum is relatively easy to grow and can be propagated through seeds or stem cuttings.
